summary: The Countering Corrupt Political (CCP) Influence Act mandates that the Secretary of State require covered countries (China, Russia, Iran, North Korea, Cuba, Venezuela, Nicaragua, and Afghanistan under Taliban control) to notify the Department of State 96 hours in advance of meetings between their officials and U.S. state/local officials or visits to educational/research institutions. It also requires monthly reports to Congress, a threat assessment report within 4.5 years, and sunsets the requirements after 5 years.
